Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Implement six-tier recommendation system with invariant enforcement

Round 2 Testing Fixes:
- Six-tier recommendation system (Strong Apply, Apply, Consider, Apply with Caution, Long Shot, Do Not Apply)
- Score-decision invariant enforcement - prevents 78% + "Do Not Apply" mismatches
- Seniority detection module - tier-appropriate guidance for exec/director/manager/IC
- QA sanitization module - removes AI patterns, prevents cross-candidate leakage
- The Opportunity section - strategic context signals (Why now, Why this org, etc.)

Key Changes:
- backend/recommendation/final_controller.py: New six-tier Recommendation enum, score-decision lock functions, invariant enforcement
- backend/backend.py: Updated force_apply_experience_penalties() for six-tier system
- backend/seniority_detector.py: NEW - Detects candidate seniority, provides tier-appropriate guidance
- backend/qa_sanitization.py: NEW - Output validation, em dash removal, leakage detection
- backend/reality_check/signal_detectors.py: Added detect_opportunity_signals() for strategic context
- docs/guides/JOB_FIT_SCORING_SPEC.md: Updated to v3.0 with six-tier documentation

Fixes Issues:
- Score-Decision inconsistency (78% + Do Not Apply now impossible)
- Generic coaching for executives (seniority-aware guidance)
- Reality Check too generic (The Opportunity section)
- QA issues (typos, em dashes, repeated phrasing)

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Add feedback acknowledgment emails + fix document refinement persistence

Feedback Acknowledgment Emails:
- Add POST /api/send-feedback-acknowledgment endpoint using Resend API
- Create HTML email templates for each feedback type (bug, feature_request, praise, ux_issue, general)
- Integrate email sending in hey-henry.js after successful feedback submission
- Fire-and-forget pattern - doesn''t block feedback flow

Document Refinement Fixes:
- Fix Hey Henry falsely claiming to make document changes when refinement can''t run
- Add explicit page check - redirect users to Documents page if they try to refine elsewhere
- Add DOCUMENT MODIFICATION LIMITATION section to Hey Henry prompt
- Create application record in Supabase if none exists when refining documents
- Ensures refined documents persist across logout/login

Root cause: Refinements only saved to sessionStorage, and if no application existed in Supabase, changes were lost on logout.

fix: Improve Hey Henry follow-up questions for feedback

More specific, actionable follow-up questions by type:

Bug reports:
- What were you trying to do?
- What happened instead?
- What page were you on?
- Mentions screenshot option

Feature requests:
- What problem would this solve?
- Have you seen this done well elsewhere?

UX issues:
- What were you trying to do?
- What did you expect to happen?

Praise:
- Which feature stood out most?
- Anything we could do better?

General feedback:
- What page/feature is this about?
- What were you trying to accomplish?
- What would make it better?

Bash(gh pr create --title "feat: Strengthen Your Resume module + LinkedIn Analysis" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary

- **Strengthen Your Resume module**: New flow that audits resume bullets, asks targeted clarification questions, and produces verified enhancements for document generation. Enforces zero-fabrication before any documents are generated.
- **LinkedIn Analysis page**: Full implementation connecting to existing linkedin-scoring.html infrastructure with score summary, section breakdown, and priority fixes.

### New Flow:
```
JD Submission + Job Fit Score
â†’ Resume Leveling Analysis
â†’ Strengthen Your Resume (NEW)
â†’ LinkedIn Analysis (conditional: if profile uploaded, analyze; if not, prompt upload)
â†’ Application Strategy Overview
â†’ Document Generation
```

### Backend Changes:
- Extended `backend/prompts/leveling.py` with `bullet_audit` output
- Created `backend/prompts/strengthen.py` with question/apply prompts
- Created `backend/models/strengthen.py` with Pydantic models
- Refactored `backend/strengthen_session.py` with tag-based system
- Added `/api/strengthen/questions` and `/api/strengthen/apply` endpoints

### Frontend Changes:
- Replaced `frontend/strengthen.html` with new tag-based UI
- Created `frontend/components/strengthen-flow.js` for flow logic
- Created `frontend/linkedin-upload.html` for profile upload
- Implemented `frontend/linkedin-analysis.html` with scoring integration
- Updated navigation in `frontend/resume-leveling.html`

## Test plan

- [ ] Submit JD and view resume leveling â†’ See bullet_audit in response
- [ ] Enter strengthen flow â†’ Questions generated without example answers
- [ ] Answer/skip questions â†’ Enhancements applied correctly
- [ ] Verify strengthenedData persists to sessionStorage
- [ ] Navigate to LinkedIn upload/analysis conditionally
- [ ] Continue to Strategy Overview (overview.html)

EOF

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Add resume strength gate for bullet-level quality scoring

Implements a comprehensive strength assessment system that scores resume
bullets 0-100 across 5 factors: scope clarity (25), outcome specificity (30),
verb strength (20), comparative context (10), and business impact (15).

Key features:
- Bullet-level scoring identifies weak bullets that need strengthening
- Level-aware verb tiers (entry â†’ mid â†’ senior â†’ director)
- Confidence-gated amplification prevents auto-applying risky rewrites
- Phase 2 question generation for bullets needing user context
- Resume trajectory assessment (title progression, scope escalation)
- Fallback handling (drop/deprioritize/keep-with-warning)

Thresholds:
- Resume avg < 50: Block export
- Resume avg 50-64: Amplification required
- Resume avg 65+: Proceed
- Individual bullet < 60: Flagged as weak

Integration: Runs after quality gates in /api/documents/generate,
results added to response as strength_assessment.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
